maml:description.maml:para: Adds a dataset to a Power BI workspace.
Publishes a dataset to Power BI service under a workspace.

maml:Description.maml:para: The dataset to be added.
Workspace to add the dataset. If not specified, the dataset will reside under "My Workspace".
The dataset to be added.
ID of the workspace to add the dataset. If not specified, the dataset will reside under "My Workspace".
The dataset to be added.
Workspace to add the dataset. If not specified, the dataset will reside under "My Workspace".
ID of the workspace to add the dataset. If not specified, the dataset will reside under "My Workspace".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$col1 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name ID -DataType Int64 PS C:\>$col2 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Data -DataType String PS C:\>$table1 = New-PowerBITable -Name SampleTable1 -Columns $col1,$col2 PS C:\> PS C:\>$col3 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name ID -DataType Int64 PS C:\>$col4 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Date -DataType DateTime PS C:\>$col5 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Detail -DataType String PS C:\>$col6 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Result -DataType Double PS C:\>$table2 = New-PowerBITable -Name SampleTable2 -Columns $col3,$col4,$col5,$col6 PS C:\> PS C:\>$dataset = New-PowerBIDataSet -Name SampleDataSet -Tables $table1,$table2 PS C:\> PS C:\>Add-PowerBIDataSet -DataSet $dataset

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example instantiates a table with two columns and another table with four columns, and instantiates a dataset. Then, it creates the dataset in Power BI under "My Workspace".

maml:description.maml:para: Adds rows to the specified table in a Power BI dataset.
Inserts rows into a Power BI table contained within a dataset.

maml:Description.maml:para: A dataset containing the table where rows are to be stored.
An array of rows to be stored in the table.
Name of the table.
Workspace containing the dataset and table for row insertion.
ID of the workspace containing the dataset and table for row insertion.
ID of the dataset containing the table where rows are to be stored.
An array of rows to be stored in the table.
Name of the table.
Workspace containing the dataset and table for row insertion.
ID of the workspace containing the dataset and table for row insertion.
A dataset containing the table where rows are to be stored.
ID of the dataset containing the table where rows are to be stored.
An array of rows to be stored in the table.
Name of the table.
Workspace containing the dataset and table for row insertion.
ID of the workspace containing the dataset and table for row insertion.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.PowerBI.Common.Api.Workspaces.Workspace

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example inserts two rows to Table1.
This example inserts rows from CSV to Table1.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports a Power BI dataflow to the .json file format.

Export a Power BI dataflow from the Power BI service into a .json file that represents a Dataflow object. For -Scope Individual, user must specify the dataflow's workspace, using the given -WorkspaceId value. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Dataflow for exporting.
Output file to save the exported dataflow to. Path must not already exist.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual works only with the -WorkspaceId parameter, which indicates the Workspace of the requested Dataflow. Organization exports the requested dataflow from within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace containing the Power BI dataflow to export.
ID of the dataflow to export.
Output file to save the exported dataflow to. Path must not already exist.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual works only with the -WorkspaceId parameter, which indicates the Workspace of the requested Dataflow. Organization exports the requested dataflow from within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace containing the Power BI dataflow to export.
Dataflow for exporting.
ID of the dataflow to export.
Output file to save the exported dataflow to. Path must not already exist.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual works only with the -WorkspaceId parameter, which indicates the Workspace of the requested Dataflow. Organization exports the requested dataflow from within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace containing the Power BI dataflow to export.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export dataflow with ID 9b519499-5ba1-4f1c-878b-be3a69f1791f from a workspace with Id ed451706-2b02-430c-b25c-20c0842c6375 into a file named Sales.json in your current working directory ($PWD).
Export dataflow with ID 9b519499-5ba1-4f1c-878b-be3a69f1791f from within the user's organization into a file named Sales.json in the current working directory ($PWD).

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Power BI dataflows.

Retrieves a list of Power BI dataflows that match the specified search criteria and scope. For -Scope Individual, dataflows are returned only from the specified workspace, using the given -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. For -Scope Organization, dataflows could be returned from the entire user's organization. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase). Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
First (top) list of results.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
ID of the workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown.
OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase). Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
First (top) list of results.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
Workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown. Supports pipelining of Cmdlets that return Workspace objects.
ID of the dataflow to return.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown.
ID of the dataflow to return.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown. Supports pipelining of Cmdlets that return Workspace objects.
Name of the dataflow to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown.
Name of the dataflow to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown. Supports pipelining of Cmdlets that return Workspace objects.
OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase). Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
First (top) list of results.
ID of the dataflow to return.
Name of the dataflow to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.

Indicates the scope of the call. Individual scope must be run with -Workspace or -WorkspaceId parameters. Organization scope returns all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
Workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown. Supports pipelining of Cmdlets that return Workspace objects.
ID of the workspace to filter results to, only dataflows belonging to that workspace are shown.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a list of all Power BI dataflows in workpsace with ID ed451706-2b02-430c-b25c-20c0842c6375 that the user has access to.
Returns a list of all Power BI dataflows within a user's organization.
Returns a dataflow with the Name "MyDataflow" from within all the organization.
Returns a list of the first 20 dataflows in a workspace with ID ed451706-2b02-430c-b25c-20c0842c6375 that the user has access to.
Returns a dataflow with ID 672403a7-34b7-493c-8ab1-3f1066573dc5 in a workspace with ID ed451706-2b02-430c-b25c-20c0842c6375.
Returns all dataflows configured by 'john@contoso.com' within the user's organization.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Power BI data sources for the given Dataflow.

Retrieves a list of Power BI data sources under the specified dataflow that match the specified search criteria and scope. Data sources connected to Dataflows doesn't have a Name value, so there is no 'Name' parameter. For -Scope Individual, user must specify the dataflow's workspace, using the given -WorkspaceId value. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Dataflow object to retrieve and return data sources for.
ID of the data source to return.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only data sources from dataflows assigned to the caller; Organization returns data sources for all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to. Only data sources belonging to that workspace are shown. Available only when -Scope is Individual.
Dataflow object to retrieve and return data sources for.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only data sources from dataflows assigned to the caller; Organization returns data sources for all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to. Only data sources belonging to that workspace are shown. Available only when -Scope is Individual.
ID of the dataflow to retrieve and return data sources for.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only data sources from dataflows assigned to the caller; Organization returns data sources for all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to. Only data sources belonging to that workspace are shown. Available only when -Scope is Individual.
ID of the dataflow to retrieve and return data sources for.
ID of the data source to return.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only data sources from dataflows assigned to the caller; Organization returns data sources for all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to. Only data sources belonging to that workspace are shown. Available only when -Scope is Individual.
Dataflow object to retrieve and return data sources for.
ID of the dataflow to retrieve and return data sources for.
ID of the data source to return.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only data sources from dataflows assigned to the caller; Organization returns data sources for all dataflows within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
ID of the workspace to filter results to. Only data sources belonging to that workspace are shown. Available only when -Scope is Individual.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all data sources in a Power BI dataflow with ID 23d088a0-a395-483e-b81c-54f51f3e4e3c, for a dataflow the calling user has access to in the given workspace.
Returns all data sources in a Power BI dataflow with ID 23d088a0-a395-483e-b81c-54f51f3e4e3c, for a dataflow in the calling user's organization.
Returns a data source with ID a3066be2-ea12-4ae2-b8e9-b8006b1fbf61, in a dataflow with ID 23d088a0-a395-483e-b81c-54f51f3e4e3c the calling user has access to in the given workspace.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-PowerBIDataflow -Scope Organization -Name "MyDataflow" | Get-PowerBIDatasource -Scope Organization

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all data sources in a Power BI dataflow with Name "MyDataflow", using a pipeline result from a call to Get-PowerBIDataflow.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Power BI datasets.

Retrieves a list of Power BI datasets that match the specified search criteria and scope. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount. For -Scope Individual, datasets are returned from "My Workspace" unless -Workspace or -WorkspaceId is specified.

maml:Description.maml:para: OData filter, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase). Only supported when -Scope Organization is specified.
First (top) list of results.
OData expand, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase).

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns datasets from "My Workspace" by default. With -Workspace or -WorkspaceId, datasets under the workspace assigned to the caller are returned; Organization returns all datasets within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
ID of the workspace to filter results to, datasets only belonging to that workspace are shown.
First (top) list of results.
OData expand, case-sensitive (element names start lowercase).

Returns a list of all Power BI datasets within a user's organization.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Power BI data sources.

Retrieves a list of Power BI data sources under the specified dataset along that match the specified search criteria and scope. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all data sources in Power BI dataset with ID 23d088a0-a395-483e-b81c-54f51f3e4e3c, for dataset the calling user has access to.
Returns all data sources in Power BI dataset with ID 23d088a0-a395-483e-b81c-54f51f3e4e3c, for a dataset in the calling user's organization.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of Power BI tables.
Retrieves a list of Power BI tables in the dataset that match the specified search criteria. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Login-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: The dataset where the tables are stored.
First (top) list of results.
Name of the table to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.

Indicates scope of the call. Individual returns only tables under datasets assigned to the caller; Organization returns tables under any dataset within a tenant (must be an administrator to initiate). Individual is the default.
Skips the first set of results.
Workspace to filter results to, tables only belonging to that workspace are shown.
ID of the workspace to filter results to, tables only belonging to that workspace are shown.
ID of the dataset where the tables are stored.
First (top) list of results.
Name of the table to return if one exists with that name. Case insensitive search.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a list of all Power BI tables in dataset eed49d27-8e3c-424d-9342-c6b3ca6db64d
Returns a list of all Power BI tables in datasets which supports AddRowApi.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Power BI column object.
Initiates the creation of a new Power BI column object. Columns are building blocks for constructing a table object.

maml:Description.maml:para: A type of the column.
A column name.
A type of the column.
A column name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$col1 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name ID -DataType Int64 PS C:\>$col2 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Data -DataType String PS C:\>$table1 = New-PowerBITable -Name SampleTable1 -Columns $col1,$col2 PS C:\> PS C:\>$col3 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name ID -DataType Int64 PS C:\>$col4 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Date -DataType DateTime PS C:\>$col5 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Detail -DataType String PS C:\>$col6 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Result -DataType Double PS C:\>$table2 = New-PowerBITable -Name SampleTable2 -Columns $col3,$col4,$col5,$col6 PS C:\> PS C:\>$dataset = New-PowerBIDataSet -Name SampleDataSet -Tables $table1,$table2 PS C:\> PS C:\>Add-PowerBIDataSet -DataSet $dataset

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example instantiates a table with two columns and another table with four columns, and instantiates a dataset. Then, it creates the dataset in Power BI.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Power BI dataset object.
Initiates the creation of a Power BI dataset object. A Power BI dataset is a container for tables.

maml:Description.maml:para: Dataset Name.
An array of Table objects
Dataset Name.
An array of Table objects

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$currentTables = Get-PowerBITable -DatasetId c47f6cff-70de-4837-a094-93a6f26e20bf
$currentTable = $currentTables[0] $col1 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Col1 -DataType Int64 $col2 = New-PowerBIColumn -Name Col2 -DataType String $updatedTable = New-PowerBITable -Name $currentTable.Name -Columns $col1,$col2
Set-PowerBITable -Table $updatedTable -DatasetId c47f6cff-70de-4837-a094-93a6f26e20bf

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves current table and create new one from the table. Then, it updates the table schema.
